page.title: 08PENTON HOOK LOCK
page.content: The lock is a favourite place for a walk in the summer to watch all the boats. The locks were built by the City of London to by_pass the weir.The first one was built in 1814 and then re_built in 1908.In 1857 the lock was given to the Thames Conservancy.The river was used in years past by many ships and barges carrying goods such as coal and wood.Now it is used mainly by pleasure craft.About 40 000 boats a year go through the lock. Around the hook,the big bend in the river,there were many weirs to give power to mills.None of these remain now,except for place names.
